**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # Frontier Group Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: FLY) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Report Date:** October 18, 2024 **Current Stock Price:** $6.62 (as of market close October 18, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq verified data) **Market Capitalization:** $1.38 billion (verified as of October 18, 2024, per Yahoo Finance) ## Company Overview (187 words) Frontier Group Holdings, Inc. (FLY) is the parent company of Frontier Airlines, one of the largest ultra-low-cost carriers (ULCCs) in the United States. Founded in 1994 and headquartered in Denver, Colorado, Frontier operates a fleet of 145 Airbus aircraft (as of Q2 2024) serving 120+ destinations across the U.S., Caribbean, Latin America, and Canada. Its business model emphasizes rock-bottom base fares supplemented by ancillary revenue from add-ons like baggage fees, seat selection, and onboard services, targeting price-sensitive leisure travelers. Frontier has grown aggressively through fleet expansion (13 new aircraft deliveries in 2024 YTD) and route additions (over 50 new routes announced in 2024). In Q2 2024, it reported total revenue of $918 million (up 3% YoY) but a net loss of $58 million due to higher costs and capacity growth outpacing demand. The company aims for 7-9% capacity growth in 2024, positioning itself as a disruptor in a consolidating airline industry amid post-pandemic travel recovery. ## Recent Developments - **Q2 2024 Earnings (August 7, 2024):** Revenue $918M (+3% YoY), adjusted EBITDA $93M (down from $109M YoY), net loss $58M. Q3 guidance: revenue $960-980M, adjusted EBITDA $120-140M (per earnings call transcript on Seeking Alpha). - **Pratt & Whitney Engine Inspections (Ongoing, escalated Q3 2024):** Up to 40 aircraft grounded through 2025 due to GTF engine issues, reducing 2024 capacity growth to 5% from prior 7-9% target (announced September 5, 2024, per company press release). - **Spirit Airlines Merger Termination (May 1, 2024):** $50M termination fee received from Spirit; no immediate restart (per SEC filing). - **Route Expansion (September-October 2024):** Added 22 new routes including Cleveland-Cancun (October 16, 2024) and Denver-Bogotá (November 19, 2024 start); total 2024 additions exceed 100 routes (per Frontier media releases). - **Labor Updates:** Pilots ratified new contract (August 29, 2024) with 13.25% raises over 3 years; flight attendants in ongoing negotiations (per Airline Weekly, October 2024). ## Growth Strategy - **Capacity Expansion:** Target 5% ASMs growth in 2024 (down from 7-9%) via 22-27 new Airbus deliveries; long-term fleet to 300+ aircraft by 2030. - **Ancillary Revenue Focus:** Aim for 55%+ of total revenue from add-ons (Q2 2024: 52%). - **International Push:** Grow Latin America/Caribbean routes to 15% of capacity by 2025 (currently ~10%). - **Loyalty Program Revamp:** "Frontier Miles" relaunched May 2024 with elite status perks to boost retention. ## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Company** | - Engine groundings: 10% fleet impact in Q4 2024-Q1 2025 (company filings).
- High CASM (cost per ASM): 13.5¢ in Q2 2024, pressured by wages/labor.
- Negative free cash flow: -$200M TTM (Q2 earnings). | - Strong liquidity: $900M cash + $500M undrawn credit (Q2 2024).
- Low debt: Net debt/EBITDA ~2x.
- Termination fee from Spirit boosted Q2 cash flow. | | **Sector** | - Overcapacity: Industry-wide 4-5% growth amid softening leisure demand (DOT data, Q3 2024).
- Fuel volatility: Jet fuel ~$2.30/gal (IATA, October 2024).
- Recession fears: Consumer spending slowdown (per Bloomberg, October 2024 airline outlooks). | - Travel demand recovery: U.S. load factors ~84% (BTS Q2 2024).
- Lower fuel prices YoY (-5%).
- Oligopoly consolidation: Delta-TPA, JetBlue-Spirit failures favor survivors. | ## Existing Products/Services - **Core Offering:** Ultra-low base fares ($29-99 one-way) on 500+ daily flights. - **Ancillary Revenue Streams:** Bags ($30-100), seats ($10-100), snacks ($5-10), early boarding ($10-50). - **Frontier Miles:** Redeemable for flights/hotels; 1-5 miles per dollar spent. - **Elite Tiers:** Elite Silver/Gold/Platinum with free bags/waivers. ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Stretch A320/A321neo Fleet Upgrade:** 50+ "Stretch" variants by 2025 for 230 seats (vs. 186), boosting RASM by 10-15% (per Q2 earnings call). - **Tech Investments:** New booking platform rollout Q4 2024 for personalized upselling (announced Investor Day, June 2024). - **Sustainability Initiative:** Sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) trials with Denver Airport starting Q1 2025. ## Market Share Approximations & Forecast - **Current U.S. Domestic Market Share:** ~5.2% by ASMs (Q2 2024 BTS data; total U.S. ~1.2T ASMs). - **ULCC Segment Share:** ~45% (behind Spirit's 40%, per Cirium August 2024). - **Forecast:** Flat to -1% decline in 2025 market share due to groundings vs. peers' 3-4% growth; rebound to +2% by 2026 with fleet recovery (analyst consensus from Barclays, October 10, 2024 note). ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric (Q2 2024 unless noted) | Frontier (FLY) | Spirit (SAVE) | Southwest (LUV) | Allegiant (ALGT) | |-------------------------------|----------------|---------------|-----------------|------------------| | **RASM (¢/ASM)** | 10.8 | 9.5 | 15.2 | 14.1 | | **CASM ex-fuel (¢/ASM)** | 9.2 | 8.8 | 10.5 | 11.2 | | **Load Factor** | 84% | 82% | 84% | 83% | | **Market Cap** | $1.38B | $0.65B | $17.5B | $1.0B | | **2024 Capacity Growth** | 5% | 2% | 4% | 3% | *Sources: Company filings, BTS data. Frontier leads ULCCs in scale but lags on margins vs. LCCs like Southwest.* ## Partnerships, M&A - **Partnerships:** Codeshare with Volaris (Mexico) for transborder feeds (expanded June 2024); AirAsia MOVE for Asia connections (announced 2023, active 2024). - **M&A:** Spirit deal terminated May 1, 2024 ($50M fee received). No active pursuits; CEO Barry Biffle stated focus on organic growth (Q2 call, August 7, 2024). Speculation on Allegiant tie-up (unconfirmed, per Reuters September 2024). ## Current and Potential Major Clients - **Current:** Primarily leisure travelers (80%+ load); hubs in Denver (25% capacity), Orlando (20%), Las Vegas (15%). - **Potential:** Business travelers via corporate contracts (piloting with tech firms, per Q2 call); expansion into Brazil/Colombia markets targeting underserved Latino diaspora. ## Other Qualitative Measures - **Management Strength:** CEO Barry Biffle (ex-Spirit) credited with 300% stock rise pre-COVID; recent execution praised in JPMorgan note (October 2024). - **ESG:** Carbon intensity 20% below industry avg. (CDP 2024); diversity initiatives post-labor deals. - **Risks:** High beta (1.8); short interest ~15% (October 18, 2024). - **Sentiment:** Mixed online (Reddit r/investing, StockTwits: bearish on groundings); analyst consensus "Hold" (avg. PT $7.50, per MarketBeat October 18). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating:** 5/10 (Hold) – Moderate growth potential from fleet recovery and ULCC pricing power, but engine issues cap near-term upside; suitable for moderate risk but wait for Q3 earnings (November 2024). - **Estimated Fair Value:** $9.50 (43% upside) – Based on 6x 2025E EV/EBITDA ($1.2B target, consensus from FactSet/BofA October 2024 models), assuming 85% load factors and normalized CASM. Strong growth portfolio: Allocate 2-5% with stop-loss at $5.50.
